PERSONAL PROFILE                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Recently graduated with an Upper Se cond -Class Honours deg ree from the University of Leeds, having studied chemical 
engineering as an Integrated Masters’ degree. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills coupled with an ability 
to work effectively both individually and collaboratively  as part of a team whe n required: thriving in challenging and fast -
moving environments by prioritising tasks and targets with strong time management skills and exceptional work 
discipline. Experience in engineering and data analysis through internships at the Royal Navy, Avado,  and working at 
UK Biocentre.

ENGINEERING PROJECTS  
Year 4  (Dissertation):  Enhanced Oil Recovery Using Nanoparticle  
• The Masters’ research project involved the functionalisation of car boxylic and silica nanoparticles which had the 
capability of reducing the interfacial tension and wettability required to enhance oil recovery within the reservoir.  
• The Stober technique wa s exploited for the functionalisation of carboxylic acid silica nan oparticles along with 
characterisation methods such as scanning (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) for analysis of 
nanoparticles. Collected  extensive amount of data from labor atory experiments and similar existing published 
papers. The data w as scrut inised  and the results and their potential impact on society were presented to 
technical and non -technical audiences
